subject: Why is it considered an error if there is no test in the file?
msgSnippet: From the faq the pattern everyone else seems to be using is that their tests are in a seperate java file from their code.  I d like to spinkle test methods

From the faq the pattern everyone else seems to be using is that their
test=
s are in a seperate java file from their code.  I'd like to
spinkle test me=
thods throughout my code, so the test can be right next
to the code it is t=
esting.  I'd like to create a junit ant task that
just runs on my whole cod=
ebase, but not all of my classes will have
test methods and I'll get an err=
or for each class that doesn't (and I
don't want to have to explictily add =
each class to my build.xml file
when I add a test).  So how do I tell junit=
 that it isn't an error if
a class does not have a test method?
